2 Chronicles or 2 Paralipomenon__36.1: Then the people of the land took Joachaz the son of Josias, and made him king instead of his father in Jerusalem.
2 Chronicles or 2 Paralipomenon__36.2: Joachaz was three and twenty years old when he began to reign, and he reigned three months in Jerusalem.
2 Chronicles or 2 Paralipomenon__36.3: And the king of Egypt came to Jerusalem, and deposed him, and condemned the land in a hundred talents of silver, and a talent of gold.
2 Chronicles or 2 Paralipomenon__36.4: And he made Eliakim his brother king in his stead, over Juda and Jerusalem: and he turned his name to Joakim: but he took Joachaz with him, and carried him away into Egypt.
2 Chronicles or 2 Paralipomenon__36.5: Joakim was five and twenty years old when he began to reign, and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem: and he did evil before the Lord his God.
2 Chronicles or 2 Paralipomenon__36.6: Against him came up Nabuchodonosor king of the Chaldeans, and led him bound in chains into Babylon.
2 Chronicles or 2 Paralipomenon__36.7: And he carried also thither the vessels of the Lord, and put them in his temple.
2 Chronicles or 2 Paralipomenon__36.8: But the rest of the acts of Joakim, and his abominations, which he wrought, and the things that were found in him, are contained in the book of the kings of Juda and Israel. And Joachin his son reigned in his stead.
2 Chronicles or 2 Paralipomenon__36.9: Joachin was<u>eight years old</u>when he began to reign, and he reigned three months and ten days in Jerusalem, and he did evil in the sight of the Lord.
2 Chronicles or 2 Paralipomenon__36.10: And at the return of the year, king Nabuchodonosor sent, and brought him to Babylon, carrying away at the same time the most precious vessels of the house of the Lord: and he made Sedecias his uncle king over Juda and Jerusalem.
2 Chronicles or 2 Paralipomenon__36.11: Sedecias was one and twenty years old when he began to reign: and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem.
2 Chronicles or 2 Paralipomenon__36.12: And he did evil in the eyes of the Lord his God, and did not reverence the face of Jeremias the prophet speaking to him from the mouth of the Lord.
2 Chronicles or 2 Paralipomenon__36.13: He also revolted from king Nabuchodonosor, who had made him swear by God: and he hardened his neck and his heart, from returning to the Lord the God of Israel.
2 Chronicles or 2 Paralipomenon__36.14: Moreover all the chief of the priests, and the people wickedly transgressed according to all the abominations of the Gentiles: and they defiled the house of the Lord, which he had sanctified to himself in Jerusalem.
2 Chronicles or 2 Paralipomenon__36.15: And the Lord the God of their fathers sent to them, by the hand of his messengers, rising early, and daily admonishing them: because he spared his people and his dwelling place.
2 Chronicles or 2 Paralipomenon__36.16: But they mocked the messengers of God, and despised his words, and misused the prophets, until the wrath of the Lord arose against his people, and there was no remedy.
2 Chronicles or 2 Paralipomenon__36.17: For he brought upon them the king of the Chaldeans, and he slew their young men with the sword in the house of his sanctuary, he had no compassion on young man, or maiden, old man or even him that stooped for age, but he delivered them all into his hands.
2 Chronicles or 2 Paralipomenon__36.18: And all the vessels of the house of the Lord, great and small, and the treasures of the temple and of the king, and of the princes he carried away to Babylon.
2 Chronicles or 2 Paralipomenon__36.19: And the enemies set fire to the house of God, and broke down the wall of Jerusalem, burnt all the towers, and whatsoever was precious they destroyed.
2 Chronicles or 2 Paralipomenon__36.20: Whosoever escaped the sword, was led into Babylon, and there served the king and his sons till the reign of the king of Persia.
2 Chronicles or 2 Paralipomenon__36.21: That the word of the Lord by the mouth of Jeremias might be fulfilled, and the land might keep her sabbaths: for all the days of the desolation she kept a sabbath, till the seventy years were expired.
2 Chronicles or 2 Paralipomenon__36.22: But in the first year of Cyrus king of the Persians, to fulfill the word of the Lord, which he had spoken by the mouth of Jeremias, the Lord stirred up the heart of Cyrus king of the Persians who commanded it to be proclaimed through all his kingdom, and by writing also, saying:
2 Chronicles or 2 Paralipomenon__36.23: Thus saith Cyrus king of the Persians: All the kingdoms of the earth hath the Lord the God of heaven given to me, and he hath charged me to build him a house in Jerusalem, which is in Judea: who is there among you of all his people? The Lord his God be with him, and let him go up.
